captions.text: There's a question that troubles us all.
From the time we are first able to think.
And that is, Where did we come from?
And this question is so compelling
That we've invented the science of astronomy
We've discovered these natural laws
So that we can learn more about our origin
and where we came from.
This is what drives us.
This is what we want to know
Let's keep looking, let's keep searching.
We have come to be because of the universe's existence
And we are driven to pursue that, to find out
Where we came from.
The joy of discovery!
That's what drives us.
And these questions are deep within us.
Where did we come from?
What was before the big bang?
To us this is wonderful and charming and compelling
This is what makes us get up and go to work everyday
We are - you and I -
At least one of the ways
That the universe knows itself
It fills me with joy to make discoveries every day
Of things I had never seen before.
To know that we can pursue these answers.
Where did we come from?

title: Bill Nye - The Joy of Discovery - by Melodysheep

comments.text:
I'd love to see a tribute to....and I know this might seem silly, Ernest, 
or rather, Jim Varney. I know he died a long time ago, but I think it would 
be really nice to see. Plus I think it would work really well & you'd find 
perfect stuff to put in it. Also, he'd probably sound pretty awesome. :)  
(I still can't watch the Robin Williams one you did, even though I'm sure 
it's amazingly good. It's one of the hardest deaths of anyone famous I've 
ever had to deal with. I just know I'd be bawling my fucking eyes out. Plus 
your videos/songs always tend to evoke such strong emotions from me anyhow. 
They are just so powerful in so many ways, and the musical parts have this 
intense, emotional, evoking, provoking feeling to them. Especially Symphony 
of Science. Half of them make me cry for some reason, they just are that 
powerful. You're really great at this, so don't ever stop. I also think 
Symphony of Science would really be a wonderful method for teaching anyone. 
Especially young people though, and I personally find myself so much more 
deeply captivated & interested & wowed than if it was just the regular 
videos, even though those are already powerful. Then there's this added 
bonus of really loving the songs so much that they not only get stuck in 
your head, but that you eventually know all the words & remember the 
information. I think if there had been a method like this to teach me 
things, I wouldn't have had such a hard time. )﻿

comments.author: Martin Osuna

comments.text:
+Martin Osuna I did not reply to your comment as though you were religious. 
I just identified the "relationship" between science and god. If anyone can 
discover evidence for a god, then it shall be accepted as part of science. 
However, if there is no evidence for one, then we shall withhold judgement 
and assume it's not true. We don't even know if the Big Bang had a source 
of creation, if anything created the Big Bang. So, for now, since there is 
no evidence for a source of creation any further than the Big Bang, the Big 
Bang shall be counted as the source of creation, not a "god" in any sense 
of the word, unless you're saying the Big Bang is "god".
comments.author: LJ Shaun

comments.text:
+LJ Shaun I am not religious, i meant god as the source of creation, 
whatever that might be, your perception of what the concept of god is very 
limited, both from a religious or scientific point of view we ask the same 
questions, i as i told you am not religious, truth is another concept you 
should try to use less lightly, specially if you think there is a "THE 
truth".
comments.author: Martin Osuna

comments.text:
+Martin Osuna  Science's ultimate goal is to find the truth. If the truth 
does not involve a god, then that's what science will accept. If the truth 
is there is a god, science will acknowledge his/her/its existence. Now, 
since there is no evidence to suggest that a god exists, science indicates 
there is no reason to believe in one whatsoever.
comments.author: LJ Shaun

comments.author: SoulRippster

comments.text:
+George Gzirishvili a quote is not an argument.

"String theory has been criticized by many great scientists, including 
Richard Feynman." 

Now, that's an argument from authority. I'm not interested in talking with 
inconsistent hypocrites.
comments.author: LmOver

comments.text:
+LmOver Tyson's quote is an argument from authority, but I'm going to 
answer that. Yes, that's right, but that doesn't mean that there's no way 
the Universe can make sense to us. For the most part, the Universe does 
make sense to us. That's why we can fly to the Mars, manipulate with the 
nuclear forces and create antimatter.

*"That's simply why many scientists are not atheists"*
Well, that's funny because most of the leading scientists *are* atheists:
https://www.lhup.edu/~dsimanek/sci_relig.htm

Yes, Einstein did not believe in a personal god, he believed in the god of 
order and beauty. He was a pantheist and pantheism is sexed-up atheism. 
Plus, einstein's god was killed by Niels Bohr. :)

*"If we are guided to know the truth by what makes more sense it's no 
accident to end up believing in a God."*
I don't see how this is true. If the existence of something is not 
falsifiable, then most likely it doesn't exist. If the concept of god was 
created by humans, then "god is real because it's perfect" is just like 
other unfalsifiable statements, if not, it's the ultimate truth, but we 
can't know that. Without falsifiability, it's not reasonable to consider 
the existence of anything. Do you know why science works the way it works? 
Because our brains have the ability of abstract thinking. Instead of doing 
the experiments first and then thinking about what could the outcomes mean, 
we hypothesize and then do the experiment to test it. We drop the 
falsified hypotheses and theories and work on others and try to falsify 
them. That's how we get ideas that work well.

*"[zero-energy universe hypothesis] is incompatible with actual 
calculations and string theory."*
String theory has been criticized by many great scientists, including 
Richard Feynman.

And metaphysically speaking, you could be a sleeping giraffe dreaming about 
being a human.
comments.author: George Gzirishvili

comments.text: Nope, but it might bite you in the ass some day.
comments.author: Dave Smith

comments.text:
Yes. To quote Richard Feynman: "Religion is a culture of faith; science is 
a culture of doubt."
comments.author: leafangirls

comments.text:
+George Gzirishvili "The universe is under no obligation to make sense to 
you" - Tyson

If we are guided to know the truth by what makes more sense it's no 
accident to end up believing in a God. The explanation for the existence of 
the universe makes no sense, the origin of the physical laws makes no 
sense. If the zero-energy universe hypothesis was remotely true it would 
have to go along with a vacuum genesis, which in physics makes no sense as 
well and is incompatible with actual calculations and string theory. That's 
simply why many scientists are not atheists and I'm not talking about any 
mythical God, but the God of nature, the God einstein believed in. Whatever 
it could possibly mean.

And metaphysically speaking, it would be possible for something outside the 
universe to create it, as we wouldn't be speaking about anything similar to 
our universe. No laws, no theories, no limits. The questions is.. What? But 
the answer is most likely far beyond our grasp.
comments.author: LmOver

comments.text:
+LmOver I actually think that zero-energy universe makes more sense than 
intelligent design or any creation story out there. Intelligence would be a 
more complex beginning for the Universe, so its complexity requires 
explanation itself. Thus ID is less explanatory than any hypothesis that is 
based on the mathematical models. Mathematical models are more likely to be 
accepted as an a priori justification than the statement "God is omnipotent 
and eternal, so it doesn't require a creator" which is a pure metaphysics. 
If you look at any invention and any calculation behind it, it's based on 
mathematics. Mathematics is an abstraction: we look for the patterns, 
symmetries, we generalize ideas, we generate abstractions through that we 
can understand how the universe works. Mathematics is a language we've 
created to describe things and speak with the Universe.
comments.author: George Gzirishvili

comments.text:

comments.author: LmOver

comments.text:
+Jesús Moreno No it is not. The Big Bang is a process of expansion in our 
universe that is still active today. The universe flashed into existence 
(according to the Big Bang theory) from a very small agglomeration of 
matter of extremely high density and temperatures. Hypotheses based on 
calculations (not real evidence) like the vacuum genesis, zero energy 
universe, quantum fluctuations and such try to explain what created that 
agglomeration of matter, but we can not prove its veracity.

http://www.infoplease.com/ipa/A0004428.html#ixzz3KCiFBpyB
comments.author: LmOver

comments.text: +LmOver Yes, it is.

use others ears? He then told me  where is God, if he does exist we would 
be seeing HIM. I told him HE is the one who created time and place and 
"where" and "when" are the aspects of time and place  therefore he is 
beyond time and place, the atheists professor became completely silent and 
then said "there is God but I don't believe you Muslims are the right 
ones". By the way, this professor is so indulgent in the study of brain.

comments.text:
+Mr.LawlCakes Man, I've read your comments. I feel you. I became atheist 
less than a year ago, too. (June 14th 2014) and I'm looking forward to an 
awesome anniversary of my conversion to intellectualism. I felt the very 
same things you felt. I understand how scary it is. On one side, you could 
spend eternity in hell. On the other, you might not live eternally at all. 
Just blackness without thought. Both sound terrifying and you must pick the 
side with the most logical sense. 

Just know this. Every single atheist of this generation who wasn't born 
from atheist parents, was born from theist parents who raised them on 
religious values. We all made the conversion. All of us became skeptical at 
one point. All of us took a trip on the contemplation train. All of us were 
scared and confused. The generation of the new atheists grows onwards 
everyday. You should be proud to be a product of the second enlightenment. 
You should know that you will be criticized, you will be taunted, and you 
will be shunned. But eventually, you gain speaking skills. I've convinced 
dozens of my friends to think for themselves. They all went through this 
same transformation.

I know this seems like a big, long rant, but your comment about being 
scared of hell but wanting to be atheist made me think of myself a year 
ago. I even told people I was atheist even when I still believed in god. 
Don't be discouraged by the mockers. They're just bigot losers. Welcome to 
the community of the new atheists.
comments.author: multimagictutorials

comments.text:
Fuck super bowl 49, super bowl 48 was fucking awesome. Did you even see 
that atheism commercial? Best fucking commercial ever. I couldn't even. 
Mind was blown. Did you know that the number of people unaffiliated with 
religion is up to 20% in America?!?! In fact, 1 in 3 adolescents are 
unaffiliated with religion in America. THAT NUMBER IS HUGE COMPARED TO PAST 
YEARS. Secularism, humanism, and Skepticism are growing ideologies and we 
should be proud to be products of the new atheist movement!

comments.text:
Imagine inviting someone to your home, letting him or her eat from your 
food for whatever time he or she might want. Then this someone insults you 
and denying you have given him anything above that they deny you while 
being in your home. any human being with reasoning will call this the 
utmost arogance. And This is the typical example of atheists, being created 
by THE ONE, eating from the food he created and living on his earth then 
after all that denying HIM being the creator and the giver. So this is an 
insult not to anyone but to Allah the creator who can in no second erase 
you or afflict you with a disability but still he is giving you time which 
after it if you believed in HIM it will not matter because you were given 
the time to believe but you did not. (He will say: "What number of years 
did ye stay on earth?" They will say: "We stayed a day or part of a day: 
but ask those who keep account."He will say: "Ye stayed not but a little,- 
if ye had only known! "Did ye then think that We had created you in jest, 
and that ye would not be brought back to Us (for account)?" Therefore 
exalted be Allah, the King, the Reality: there is no god but He, the Lord 
of the Throne of Honour!) apart from that By believing in HIM We are not 
going to benefit HIM or if we did not believe we are going to harm HIM. It 
is for our own sake. 
(O My servants! I have forbidden dhulm (oppression) for Myself, and I have 
made it forbidden amongst you, so do not oppress one another. O My 
servants, all of you are astray except those whom I have guided, so seek 
guidance from Me and I shall guide you. O My servants, all of of you are 
hungry except those whom I have fed, so seek food from Me and I shall feed 
you. O My servants, all of you are naked except those whom I have clothed, 
so seek clothing from Me and I shall clothe you. O My servants, you commit 
sins by day and by night, and I forgive all sins, so seek forgiveness from 
Me and I shall forgive you. O My servants, you will not attain harming Me 
so as to harm Me, and you will not attain benefiting Me so as to benefit 
Me. O My servants, if the first of you and the last of you, and the humans 
of you and the jinn of you, were all as pious as the most pious heart of 
any individual amongst you, then this would not increase My Kingdom an 
iota. O My servants, if the first of you and the last of you, and the 
humans of you and the jinn of you, were all as wicked as the most wicked 
heart of any individual amongst you, then this would not decrease My 
Kingdom an iota. O My servants, if the first of you and the last of you, 
and the humans of you and the jinn of you, were all to stand together in 
one place and ask of Me, and I were to give everyone what he requested, 
then that would not decrease what I Possess, except what is decreased of 
the ocean when a needle is dipped into it. O My servants, it is but your 
deeds that I account for you, and then recompense you for. So he who finds 
good, let him praise Allah, and he who finds other than that, let him blame 
no one but himself.)

comments.text:
+Victor Reznov Don't take the scripture as scientific fact but rather 
philosophy or a way of thinking. When we look at God as a philosophical 
idea rather than science you will find that often the ideas presented in 
the bible (as well as other "holly" books from different religions) are the 
same or similar to the philosophical ideas that can be drawn from modern 
science. Even when the philosophies from science and religion do clash it 
doesn't necessarily make one or the other wrong.  Check out Elliott Hulse 
on youtube, he's really good about balancing science and religion in this 
way.

Ya know, not one person who came here to enjoy this video believes that 
shit, so why would you take time, and waste ours, by coming here to say 
nonsense like that? Nobody cares that you believe that. It's a very small 
minded view & we have progressed beyond that idea. I only hope people like 
you become smaller in numbers as time goes on & that in my lifetime, there 
might actually be a change that forces people like you to be the ones who 
are laughed at & put into mental hospitals, because in all honesty, 
believing in imaginary beings that talk to you & you can talk to, well 
that's just insane. "Religion is doing what you are told no matter if it is 
right or wrong. Morals are doing what is right no matter what you are 
told". Also, if you honestly are too scared to question the universe around 
you & realize how much deeper the connection between us all actually is, 
that's fine, but stop trying to shove that garbage down our throats when 
it's just annoying, a waste of everyone's time & gets you laughed at. 
Unless, of course, you are just a troll, which in that case, you sir, can 
go fuck yourself completely. I wish the internet could automatically detect 
trolls & kick them off the internet & not allow them to connect again.

comments.text: God is just a word
comments.author: MrQuentinfontaine

comments.text:
+Antonio Martin I can see your point but it isn't just the written word but 
also the eye-witnesses that claim such feats and miracles WERE did happen. 
Now they could be lying or the stories could have changed over the ages. 
 Back in 6th century, Christianity itself was twisted into a religion and 
used to embezzle money from the people, who had no knowledge of the true 
word and accepted everything the catholic church told them. It's entirely 
possible that someone with the same intent but bigger goals wrote up the 
bible. That doesn't mean such a being doesn't exist.

Also, using "he" is only to familiarize with God. It isn't to humanize him 
or put a label. In our beliefs he is suppose to be our father. The true 
maker of everything. It was only natural to say "he". God is neither "he" 
nor "she", just a being in its own. 

Nobody knows for sure how we started or how everything came to be. The only 
true way we'd be able to find that out is if we master time itself. I don't 
believe that everything was created by mere chance. How intricate and 
complex the human brain is, and yet created because of an explosion? I do 
believe there is a God out there and we were created for a purpose. I do 
not claim to know what that purpose is for or if what it says in the bible 
is his true purpose, granted it is quite a strange story. 

I think we've gone off track though. My original comment was to explain why 
God isn't visually present in our world and why he doesn't interfere with 
current events, not to prove his existence or the legitimacy of the bible. 
I'm not going to argue further with you if decide to continue this as it is 
off topic.
comments.author: TheBlackHood

comments.text:
+TheBlackHood The simple fact that you call it a he means you are putting a 
earthly labe on this entitie, this is contradicting yourself. The Bible has 
as much history in it as any other mythology. They wrote their myths around 
the world they knew about, so it isn't a surprise that there are some real 
events in the myths, but all of the super natural claims are false, unless 
you can prove otherwise.

There is no point in bealiving what the Bible says over what oher 
mythologies say, I could even make an argument about Howards & Dumbledore 
existing because the Harry Potter books talk about real places in England.
comments.author: Antonio Martin

comments.text:
+Antonio Martin I never claimed to think or know what it wants. In fact 
I believe that some of the things in the bible were misinterpreted. The men 
who wrote all this down didn't have the knowledge we have today so they may 
have written down or described some things in a way that only they could 
comprehend. Who knows what he actually is like? In fact, if we are this 
technologically advanced and God is omnipotent, think of all the 
possibilities.

Anyways, the bible has NOT been proven to be fairytales, I don't know who 
told you that but there are some historically accurate events that are in 
the bible. While that may not be enough to prove everything in there Is 
TRUE, it does prove that its not a fairytale.

Now I do agree that I don't know what he thinks and it confuses me when 
people try to bind God by certain rules, yet claim he is all powerful and 
omnipotent and can do anything. I think people just believe that to comfort 
themselves. However, though I may not know his true purpose, I think it's 
different from what is written. Or at least that some things are left out.

I don't sense much hostility coming from your comments so far, but if you 
are going to bash my belief then at least provide some facts to go along 
with what you say.
comments.author: TheBlackHood

comments.text:
+TheBlackHood It is bad because that book has been proven to be fairytales. 
Also, if there is a god like entitie out there, what makes you think that 
youknow what it thinks & what it wants. That's very intellectualy dishonest
comments.author: Antonio Martin

comments.text:

became an an atheist then became a militant atheist then came across
